symptoms.name: Cranial nerve palsies
symptoms.pattern: Descending paralysis, beginning with cranial nerves

symptoms.name: Extremity weakness
symptoms.severity: Variable, can progress to respiratory failure

symptoms.name: Respiratory failure
symptoms.pattern: Can occur early, may or may not be preceded by extremity weakness

symptoms.name: Shortness of breath
symptoms.severity: Variable, can progress to respiratory failure

symptoms.name: Dyspnea
symptoms.severity: Variable, can progress to respiratory failure

vital_signs.respiratory_rate: Increased or decreased depending on severity
vital_signs.blood_pressure: May be normal or abnormal depending on severity

physical_findings: Cranial nerve palsies (e.g., diplopia, ptosis, dysarthria, dysphagia)

lab_values.botulinum toxin: Detected in serum, gastric fluid, stool, or wound

risk_factors: Contamination of wound with Clostridium botulinum spores
Unsanitary injection of heroin (black tar heroin)

required: High clinical suspicion based on characteristic clinical presentation (descending flaccid paralysis starting with cranial nerve palsies)
Laboratory confirmation (detection of botulinum toxin or isolation of C. botulinum from wound)
supportive: Epidemiologic link to a known outbreak
Exposure to risk factors (e.g., contaminated wound)
